title: [Self-directed] Student-Customized Motivation Design for Engineering Ethics and Technology History Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Engineering Concepts and General Understanding of Technological Advancements
context.additional_context: Implementation of project-based assessments using smartphone-based VR simulations.

learning_goals: Students can self-assess their levels of basic psychological needs (autonomy, competence, relatedness).

Learners can experience and explain the differences among four motivational profiles (low autonomy-low competence, high autonomy-low competence, low autonomy-high competence, high autonomy-high competence) through VR simulations.
Learners can apply engineering ethics problem-solving strategies tailored to individual motivational profiles in project deliverables.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
